info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 12:44AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN PRODUCING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT ELBERT AND HART COUNTIES UNTIL 145 AM EDT... At 1239 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a series of heavy rain producing showers and thunderstorms moving slowly northwest across Elbert and Hart Counties. These showers were producing rainfall at rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour and this heavy rain is likely to continue at times through the early morning hours, with some slow drift in the heavy rainfall areas. Area streams and creeks will rapidly rise to near bankfull in some locations, and low-lying and poor drainage areas could see deep standing water develop. Locations to be impacted include...Elberton, Hartwell, Bowman, Bowersville, Bobby Brown State Park, Russell State Park, Nancy Hart State Park, Middleton, Lake Storm Thurmond and Royston. Flooding is most likely along and near Little Beaverdam Creek and associated tributaries near the Hart and Elbert County border.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
